Package ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources

Interface ResourceManager


  • public interface ResourceManager
    Manages resources such as meshes, textures, and materials.
    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  ResourceManager.ResourceInfo
      Provides methods of obtaining the URI, name, and resource handle of a resource.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Creates a generic render data store for data of plain old data (POD) types.

      Creates a texture based on the image name, width, height, and format.

      Creates a texture based on the image name and URI.

      • getResources

        List<ResourceManager.ResourceInfo> getResources​()
        Obtains all resources.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of ResourceInfo objects for all resources.

        Returns:

      • getEmptyResourceHandle

        ResourceHandle getEmptyResourceHandle​()
        Obtains an empty resource handle.
        Returns:
        Returns an empty resource handle.

      • getResourceHandle

        ResourceHandle getResourceHandle​(String uri)
        Obtains a resource handle using a specified URI.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the unique identifier of a resource.
        Returns:
        Returns the found resource handle if any; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • createMaterial

        ResourceHandle createMaterial​(String uri,
                              String name)
        Creates a material with a specified URI and name.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the unique identifier of the new material.
        name - Indicates the material name to set.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new material if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • getMaterialDesc

        Optional<MaterialDesc> getMaterialDesc​(ResourceHandle resource)
        Obtains a material descriptor using a specified handle.
        Parameters:
        resource - Indicates the resource handle to the material.
        Returns:
        Returns the found material descriptor if any; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.

      • setMaterialDesc

        void setMaterialDesc​(ResourceHandle resource,
                     MaterialDesc materialDesc)
        Sets a material descriptor using a specified handle.
        Parameters:
        resource - Indicates the resource handle to the material.
        materialDesc - Indicates the material descriptor to set.

      • createMesh

        ResourceHandle createMesh​(String uri,
                          String name,
                          MeshBuilder meshBuilder)
        Creates a mesh.
        Parameters:
        uri - Indicates the unique identifier of the new mesh.
        name - Indicates the mesh name to set.
        meshBuilder - Indicates the data of the new mesh.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new mesh if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • getMeshDesc

        Optional<MeshDesc> getMeshDesc​(ResourceHandle resource)
        Obtains a mesh descriptor using a specified handle.
        Parameters:
        resource - Indicates the resource handle to the mesh.
        Returns:
        Returns the found mesh descriptor if any; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.

      • getEmptyGpuResourceHandle

        GpuResourceHandle getEmptyGpuResourceHandle​()
        Obtains an empty GPU resource handle.
        Returns:
        Returns an empty GPU resource handle.

      • createTexture

        GpuResourceHandle createTexture​(String name,
                                String imageUri)
        Creates a texture based on the image name and URI.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the image name to set.
        imageUri - Indicates the URI of the image.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new texture if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • createTexture

        GpuResourceHandle createTexture​(String name,
                                int width,
                                int height,
                                ImageFormat format)
        Creates a texture based on the image name, width, height, and format.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the image name to set.
        width - Indicates the width of the texture.
        height - Indicates the height of the texture.
        format - Indicates the format of the texture.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new texture if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • copyDataToImage

        void copyDataToImage​(GpuResourceHandle destination,
                     ByteBuffer data,
                     int width,
                     int height)
        Copies CPU data into a GPU image.
        Parameters:
        destination - Indicates the GPU resource handle to the destination image.
        data - Indicates the data to copy.
        width - Indicates the width of the image.
        height - Indicates the height of the image.

      • createTextureViewOes

        GpuResourceHandle createTextureViewOes​(String name,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       int textureId)
        Creates a texture view wrapping an external OpenGL ES (OES) texture.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the texture.
        width - Indicates the width of the texture.
        height - Indicates the height of the texture.
        textureId - Indicates the OES texture ID.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new texture view if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • createUniformRingBuffer

        GpuResourceHandle createUniformRingBuffer​(String name,
                                          int byteSize)
        Creates a uniform GPU buffer. You can call updateBuffer(ohos.agp.render.render3d.resources.GpuResourceHandle,java.nio.ByteBuffer) to update contents in the buffer.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the buffer to create.
        byteSize - Indicates the size of the buffer, in bytes.
        Returns:
        Returns a handle to the new buffer if it is successfully created; returns an invalid handle otherwise.

      • updateBuffer

        void updateBuffer​(GpuResourceHandle buffer,
                  ByteBuffer data)
        Updates the contents of a specified dynamic GPU buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Indicates the handle to the GPU buffer whose contents are to be updated.
        data - Indicates the data to update.

      • createExternalTextureOes

        int createExternalTextureOes​()
        Creates an external OES texture.
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the created external OES texture.

      • deleteExternalTextureOes

        void deleteExternalTextureOes​(int textureId)
        Deletes a specified external OES texture.
        Parameters:
        textureId - Indicates the external OES texture ID.

      • createRenderDataStorePod

        RenderDataStorePod createRenderDataStorePod​(String name)
        Creates a generic render data store for data of plain old data (POD) types.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the data store to create.
        Returns:
        Returns the created RenderDataStorePod object.

      • getRenderDataStorePod

        Optional<RenderDataStorePod> getRenderDataStorePod​(String name)
        Obtains a generic render data store created for data of POD types using a specified data store name.
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the name of the data store.
        Returns:
        Returns the found data store if any; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.

      • createPlayback

        Optional<AnimationPlayback> createPlayback​(ResourceHandle animationHandle,
                                           SceneNode node)
        Creates an animation playback object that can control the animation state.
        Parameters:
        animationHandle - Indicates the handle to the animation resource.
        node - Indicates the node where the animation is to be added.
        Returns:
        Returns the found AnimationPlayback object if any; returns an empty Optional object otherwise.
